Green(x) ::: x is green
Quiet(x) ::: x is quiet
Red(x) ::: x is red
White(x) ::: x is white
Big(x) ::: x is big
Cold(x) ::: x is cold
Blue(x) ::: x is blue
Premises:
Green(charlie) ::: Charlie is green.
Quiet(dave) ::: Dave is quiet.
Red(dave) ::: Dave is red.
¬White(dave) ::: Dave is not white.
¬Big(erin) ::: Erin is not big.
¬Cold(erin) ::: Erin is not cold.
Green(erin) ::: Erin is green.
Big(harry) ::: Harry is big.
Cold(harry) ::: Harry is cold.
Green(harry) ::: Harry is green.
∀x (Red(x) → ¬White(x)) ::: If someone is red then they are not white.
(Quiet(charlie) → Blue(charlie)) ::: If Charlie is quiet then Charlie is blue.
∀x ((Quiet(x) ∧ Red(x)) → Blue(x)) ::: If someone is quiet and red then they are blue.
∀x (White(x) → Cold(x)) ::: All white people are cold.
∀x (Green(x) → Quiet(x)) ::: All green people are quiet.
∀x ((Blue(x) ∧ Green(x)) → Red(x)) ::: All blue, green people are red.
∀x ((Red(x) ∧ ¬White(x)) → Big(x)) ::: If someone is red and not white then they are big.
Conclusion:
¬Red(charlie) ::: Charlie is not red.
